channel.title: Nithin C Babu
channel.description: Recent content on Nithin C Babu

item.title: Our journal paper “Quality Assessment of Low-light Restored Images: A Subjective Study and an Unsupervised Model” was published in IEEE Access
Our paper on “No Reference Opinion Unaware Quality Assessment of Authentically Distorted Images” got accepted to WACV'23
Attention and Augmented Recurrent Neural Networks
item.description: This is the ﬁrst paragraph of the article. Test a long — dash — here it is. Test for owner’s possessive. Test for “quoting a passage.” And another sentence. Or two. Some ﬂopping ﬁns; for diving. Here’s a test of an inline equation c = a^2 + b^2 . And then there’s a block equation: c = \pm \sqrt{ \sum\limits_{i=0}^{n}{a^{222} + b^2}} We can also cite external publications. .

item.title: Publications
item.description: Conference Nithin C. Babu, Vignesh Kannan, and Rajiv Soundararajan. “No reference opinion unaware quality assessment of authentically distorted images”. In Proceedings of the IEEE/CVF Winter Conference on Applications of Computer Vision (WACV), pages 2459–2468, January 2023 (paper) (project page) (video) (poster) Journal Vignesh Kannan, Sameer Malik, Nithin C. Babu, and Rajiv Soundararajan. “Quality assessment of low-light restored images: A subjective study and an unsupervised model”. IEEE Access, 11:68216–68230, July 2023 (paper) (project page)

item.title: Research
item.description: My research interests are broadly in the areas of visual information processing, deep learning, and computer vision. My current research focus is on visual quality assessment, which develops methods that predict the perceptual quality of an image or video. These methods can be used further in downstream tasks that optimize visual content delivery without compromising the perceptual quality, for example, image/video compression, streaming, enhancement, retrieval, etc. I develop methods to assess visual quality by employing a variety of tools:

item.title: Resources
item.description: Coding Pytorch training templates : Python code templates for deep learning tasks. Includes configurable modules that can deal with multiple loss functions and models. Python - MATLAB reference : Python and Matlab Reference for Linear Algebra and Image Processing

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Teaching Assistance E9 241 - Digital Image Processing : Offered by Prof. Rajiv Soundararajan in Department of ECE, IISc Bangalore. August 2023 - December 2023 term August 2022 - December 2022 term
